newsitem.title: USA: Strouds sees loss, plans store closures.
newsitem.headline: Strouds sees loss, plans store closures.

text.p: Strouds Inc said Tuesday it will record a pretax charge to its fiscal 1996 fourth quarter earnings of about $17 million for restructuring and record its first ever annual fiscal loss for 1996.
As part of a restructuring aimed at returning the specialty retailer to profitability, Strouds said it plans to close, or otherwise dispose of, up to 16 stores over the next two years.

"In addition, we are implementing a cost reduction program that more closely aligns our cost structure with projected revenues going forward which, in conjunction with pruning away underperforming assets, we expect will improve the profitability of Strouds," said President and Chief Executive Officer Wayne Selness.
Strouds sells bed, bath, tabletop and other home textiles products at 68 stores in five states.
